page.title: 16POLLUTION IN THE COUNTRYSIDE
page.content:
The area along the valley bottom,and particulary the river Don is suffering from pollution, mainly from the works higher up the river.Often the water is coloured with dyes from the paper works.Water samples taken in
this area show pollution.The area west of the Don is rich in flora and fauna, bats nest in large colonies in the new houses and near the river.Footpaths are well sign posted and maintained. Conservation work has been undertaken along the Coumes Brook which supports brown trout and fresh water shrimp. Badger,fox,heron and sparrowhawk are just a few of the species found here.
